data.title: Ben Gordon, Basketball Player
data.meta_description: Ben Gordon stats and bio. Stats averages season by season. Quick access to game by game stats.
data.text:
Ben Gordon - Points

Ben Gordon scores a career high 48 points (2007)

On March 04, 2007, Ben Gordon set his career high in points in a NBA game. That day he scored 48 points in Chicago's road win against Milwaukee, 121-126. He also had 1 rebound, 5 assists, 1 steal. He shot 12/20 from two, 6/12 from three, shooting at 56.3% from the field. He also shot 6/7 from the free-throw line.

Ben Gordon - Rebounds

Ben Gordon grabs a career high 16 rebounds (2003)

On December 20, 2003, Ben Gordon set his career high in rebounds in a NCAA game. That day he grabbed 16 rebounds in Connecticut Huskies's home win against Iona Gaels, 104-54. He also had 17 points, 11 assists, 5 steals and 1 block.

Ben Gordon - Assists

Ben Gordon gives a career high 11 assists (2003)

On December 20, 2003, Ben Gordon set his career high in assists in a NCAA game. That day he dished 11 assists in Connecticut Huskies's home win against Iona Gaels, 104-54. He also had 17 points, 16 rebounds, 5 steals and 1 block.

Ben Gordon - Steals

Ben Gordon has a career high 5 steals (2003)

On December 01, 2003, Ben Gordon tied his career high in steals in a NCAA game. That day he reached 5 steals in Connecticut Huskies's home win against Lehigh Mountain Hawks, 75-55. He also had 19 points, 3 rebounds and 4 assists.

Ben Gordon - Blocks

Ben Gordon blocks a career high 2 shots (2005)

On February 23, 2005, Ben Gordon tied his career high in blocks in a NBA game. That day he went for 2 blocks in Chicago's road loss against Cleveland, 100-91. He also had 21 points, 3 rebounds and 1 assist.

Ben Gordon - Efficiency

Ben Gordon records a career high 43 efficiency rating (2006)

On February 04, 2006, Ben Gordon tied his career high in efficiency in a NBA game. That day he accomplished 43 efficiency in Chicago's road loss against Phoenix, 118-101. He also had 39 points, 8 rebounds and 5 assists.
